sentences.sContent: ...whose shelves house our most precious memories as well as our lifetime’s knowledge...
...You go home to your house and your garden and you close the door...
...A house with a fireplace has a stronger appeal to buyers...
...Claudette lives in a small house in a fashionable section of Washington...
...But functioning fireplaces remain to this day a powerful selling point in a house or apartment...
...I heard you have moved to a new house in the suburb...
...A prominent reason public schools did well was that many highly qualified women had few options for worldng outside the house other than being teachers or nurses...
...like walking around your house in bare feet and underwear...
...most of the cost of their house is actually the cost of living in a good school district...
...She also said immigrants were responsible for pushing up UK house prices...

synos.tran: [建]住宅；家庭；机构；议会；某种用途的建筑物

trans.tranOther: a building that someone lives in, especially one that has more than one level and is intended to be used by one family
